basics.name: Ishitha Rajan, MSN, APRN, AGPCNP-BC
basics.label: Adult Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
basics.summary: Recent graduate from Vanderbilt University's Nurse Practitioner program specializing in Adult Gerontology Primary Care. Bachelor degree from University of Connecticut in Allied Health Sciences and minor in Psychology.

work.name: MarinHealth
work.summary:
560+ hours completed
● Conducted comprehensive health histories, complete and focused physical examinations, and
diagnostic test interpretation.
● Diagnosed and managed acute and chronic illnesses, recommended appropriate medications and
treatments plans in collaboration with the healthcare team.
● Provided patient education on disease prevention, medication administration, and self-care
management.

work.name: Vanderbilt University Medical Center
work.summary:
700+ hours completed in: Adult Medical-Surgical, Maternal and Newborn/ Obstetrics
Pediatric and Adolescent Unit, Psychiatric Unit, Orthopedic-Trauma Step Down, Adult Cardiac Step Down.
● Performed head-to-toe comprehensive patient assessments, assisted with patient’s activities of daily living, and monitored patients’ vital signs, pain score, and intake and output every 4 hours, while providing holistic patient centered care and communication skills.
● Performed nursing procedures such as administering patients’ medications, inserting intravenous catheters, foley catheters, enemas and suppositories and nasogastric tubes.
● Observed medical procedures such as chest tube insertions, epidurals, endoscopies, colonoscopies, cesarean sections, cardiac catheterizations, and rounded with other medical professionals.

volunteer.summary: Provided physical and emotional comfort measures to laboring patients by assisting patients with pain management techniques including positioning, therapeutic touch, and environment stimuli changes for a more comfortable birthing process.

volunteer.position: Vaccination Administrator and First Aid Kit Distributor
volunteer.summary:
● Administered COVID-19 and Hepatitis vaccinations to vulnerable populations including the homeless, individuals with disabilities, and refugee populations throughout sites in Nashville while educating them on the effects and importance of the vaccine.
● Created and distributed first aid kits for underserved populations throughout the Nashville community.

Assisted donors who had just given blood and monitored them for any signs of weakness,
dizziness, or fainting
Trained in active listening to provide support to people experiencing emotional distress via anonymous and confidential chat.

Mentored students on academic probation by helping create personalized study plans to improve
time management skills, grades, and productivity.
Created and presented a public service poster about infectious diseases to educate to the public

awards.title: National Recognition in Le Grand Concours National French Exam

certificates.name: Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers (BLS)

projects.name: Community Health Project
projects.summary:
● Performed an evidence-based quality needs assessment for villagers in San Eduardo, Ecuador to create a comprehensive Spanish website on reproductive health for children, adolescents, and parents, based on the expressed needs of the community. The website includes educational blogs, age specific videos, infographics, local resources, and a certificate of completion. https://vusnecuador.wixsite.com/puberty
   
● Disseminated website to educate the community of San Eduardo via zoom presentation held in Spanish.
● Evaluated the quality improvement project via a pretest before the zoom presentation and post-test after to assess the knowledge improvement and used these findings to create and present a poster to the local community.
